newsitem.title: USA: Shoe Carnival sees 7-10 new stores in '97.
newsitem.headline: Shoe Carnival sees 7-10 new stores in '97.

text.p: Shoe Carnival Inc said Wednesday that it plans to open seven to 10 new stores in 1997.
"Starting with the second half of this year, we anticipate accelerating Shoe Carnival's growth rate," Mark Lemond, president, said in a statement.
Five new stores opened in fiscal 1996 ended February 1.
"We intend to focus our resources in the first half of 1997 on remodeling and updating approximately 80 percent of our stores that do not already incorporate our new store design," Lemond said.
A spokeswoman said that equates to about 60 stores to be remodeled and updated.
Shoe Carnival is a chain of 92 footwear stores located in the Midwest and Midsouth.

Earlier, Shoe Carnival reported net income for the fourth quarter of $131,000 or $0.01 a share including a $0.02 credit. A year ago, it reported a loss of $8.7 million or $0.67 a share, including a $0.16 a share charge.
For the most recent fiscal year, fiscal 1996, it earned $0.32 a share, compared with a year-ago loss of $0.55.
